title: Shopping Bag, Takashimaya, 1993
medium: 3-color flexography on custom beater-dyed light beige matte-finished paper, blended wih longer fibers for durability; made in China. Hand-strung handles and hand-tied and hand-combed tassels (four per bag); collapsible.
dimensions: bucket-shaped: 18 3/16 x 11 1/2 in.; top flares to width of 16 15/16 in.; width when bag open: 5 1/2 in.
description: Medium-size bucket-shaped bag from series of packaging design concepts for the Japanese department store Takashimaya.  The store name is imprinted on the front and back of the bag. The atypical bag shape and the understated, yet elegant, design subtly evoke Japanese aesthetics and the attention traditionally applied to packaging.   The ends of each of two handles of woven cord thread through pair of holes on front and on back from inside, and are tied off leaving long tassles hanging on outside of bag; loose rectangular cardboard fits inside bottom of bag for reinforcement and narrow strips of cardboard are inside folded-over top of bag horizontally along long sides to reinforce handles.

tombstone.epitaph:
Shopping Bag, Takashimaya, 1993. 3-color flexography on custom beater-dyed light beige matte-finished paper, blended wih longer fibers for durability; made in China. Hand-strung handles and hand-tied and hand-combed tassels (four per bag); collapsible.. 
Gift of slover [AND] company. 1999-14-1
